page.description: Examples of arrays and objects in Core.js.

section.title: $u.a.find(ARRAY as array, VALUE as any [, FINDALL as logical, EXACTMATCH as logical)
section.description: Find a value in an array. If you specify the third parameter as true, the function will search the entire array, and return an array of matching indexes. Otherwise it will return the index of the first match found. The fourth parameter allows you to specify whether you would like to find exact matches, or any instances that contain the value passed in.

section.title: $u.a.dedup(ARRAY as array)
section.description:
Remove duplicate entries from an array.
Example:

section.title: $u.o.assign(OBJECT as object, BASEOBJECT as object [, KEEPORIGINALVALUES as l])
section.description:
Assign the values from a base object to another. The first parameter is the object you want to assign to. The second parameter is the object you want to assign from. The optional third parameter is a true/false as to wether you would like to keep values that already occur in the object that is being assigned to, or whether you would like to overwrite them.
